update.description:
Part 1 of an effort to remove circular dependencies in gazebo.

This pull request removes the `gazebo_[ode|simbody|dart|bullet]_physics` libraries, and instead compiles all the physics code into one `gazebo_physics` library.

End users should not be affected by this, unless they happen to directly link against one of the removed libraries instead of using pkg-config or cmake config.

[No gpu clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/494)
update.title: Circular dependencies part1

content.raw: I see, thanks for the explanation.
content.html: I see, thanks for the explanation.

content.raw: `gazebo_ode` is gazebo's version of ODE, which is necessary. We have removed `libgazebo_ode_physics`, which is the interface from ODE to Gazebo.
content.html: gazebo_ode is gazebo's version of ODE, which is necessary. We have removed libgazebo_ode_physics, which is the interface from ODE to Gazebo.

content.raw: Do we have to remove `gazebo_ode` from `pkgconfig_files` and `PKG_LIBRARIES` in the top level `CMakeList.txt`? If so, we probably won't need `cmake/pkgconfig/gazebo_ode.in`
content.html: Do we have to remove gazebo_ode from pkgconfig_files and PKG_LIBRARIES in the top level CMakeList.txt? If so, we probably won't need cmake/pkgconfig/gazebo_ode.in
